## Setting an Appointment

- Obtain an **FAA Tracking Number (FTN)** through the [Integrated Airman Certification and Rating Application (IACRA)](https://iacra.faa.gov/IACRA/Default.aspx).
  - This number is permanently associated with you throughout your career.
- Schedule a time and date for the **Part 107 knowledge test** [Unmanned Aircraft General â€“ Small (UAG)] at [FAA PSI Exams](https://faa.psiexams.com/faa/login) ($175 testing fee).
- The knowledge test consists of **60 multiple-choice questions**, randomly selected from a large pool.  
  **The minimum passing score is 70% (meaning, you'll need to get at least 42 questions right).**
- Candidates have **2 hours** to complete the test.

## Studying for the Knowledge Test

The Part 107 knowledge test covers the following topics:

- Regulations related to small unmanned aircraft system rating privileges, limitations, and flight operation.
- Airspace classification, operating requirements, and flight restrictions affecting drone operation.
- Aviation weather sources and effects of weather on drone performance.
- Drone loading and performance.
- Emergency procedures.
- Crew resource management.
- Radio communication procedures.
- Performance determination of small unmanned aircraft.
- Physiological effects of drugs and alcohol.
- Aeronautical decision-making and judgment.
- Airport operations.
- Maintenance and preflight inspection procedures.
- Night operation regulations.

## Filing an Application for the Certificate

- File an application for a **Part 107 Remote Pilot Certificate** through [IACRA](https://iacra.faa.gov/IACRA/).
- The **Transportation Security Administration (TSA)** conducts a background check.

## Keeping the Remote Pilot Certificate Current

- Complete the **Part 107 Small UAS Recurrent (ALC-677) online training course** for free at [FAA Safety](https://www.faasafety.gov/gslac/ALC/CourseLanding.aspx?cID=677).
